[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: resource_size] [Null pointer] Can passing None to resource_size() cause any unexpected behavior in size calculations used for gas metering? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_bytes_with_metadata_and_layout] [Heap fragmentation] Can repeated calls with varying resource sizes cause heap fragmentation that degrades validator performance over time? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Gas metering bypass] Can implementations return resources with incorrect sizes that bypass gas metering checks, allowing transactions to consume more resources than paid for? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Deserialization failure] When the returned Bytes fail to deserialize in the VM, does the trait guarantee proper error propagation, or can deserialization errors be silently ignored leading to undefined behavior? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Type safety violation] Can implementations return data that deserializes successfully but violates Move's type invariants (e.g., resource duplication), breaking Move's resource safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Transaction isolation] Can implementations violate transaction isolation by allowing one transaction to see uncommitted changes from another concurrent transaction? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Speculative execution] During Block-STM parallel execution, can implementations return different results for speculative vs. committed execution, causing re-execution inconsistencies? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Non-deterministic reads] Can implementations use non-deterministic sources (timestamps, random numbers, etc.) when resolving resources, causing validators to produce different state roots? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Version skew] Can implementations return resources from different storage versions or snapshots inconsistently, causing state divergence across validators? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Storage backend inconsistency] If multiple storage backends are used, can implementations return different data for the same address/tag depending on which backend is queried? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Merkle proof verification] Do implementations verify Merkle proofs before returning resource data, or can they return unverified data that doesn't match the committed state root? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Write-read consistency] After a resource is written in a transaction, can subsequent reads return stale data instead of the updated value, violating write-read consistency? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Unauthorized access] Does the trait provide any mechanism to prevent unauthorized implementations from accessing system or privileged resources at special addresses? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_bytes_with_metadata_and_layout] [Cross-module access] Can implementations be exploited to read resources belonging to modules without proper access rights, bypassing Move's module visibility rules? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Trait: ResourceResolver] [Privileged resource bypass] Can the trait be used to read resources that should only be accessible through specific Move functions with access control, bypassing those controls? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/resolver.rs] [Function: get_resource_bytes_with_metadata_and_layout] [Framework resource protection] Can implementations properly distinguish between user resources and Aptos framework system resources, preventing unauthorized modifications to critical system state?
